description: After applying the security update KB-129.0.2792.52 for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) version 129.0.2792.52, users may experience unexpected behavior where they are redirected to malicious sites when clicking on specially crafted URLs. This issue arises from the spoofing vulnerability (CVE-2024-38221), which allows an attacker to modify the content of a link, leading users to untrusted domains. Consequently, administrators should be aware that end users may report incidents of random site redirects or increased phishing attempts post-update. It is crucial for system administrators to monitor user reports and provide guidance on safe browsing practices until further mitigation is confirmed.
